title: Unit 10: Utility Analysis and Multidimensional Evaluation, Video 1: Is Optimization Possible?

media:group.media:title: Unit 10: Utility Analysis and Multidimensional Evaluation, Video 1: Is Optimization Possible?
media:group.media:description:
MIT IDS.333 Risk and Decision Analysis, Fall 2021
Instructor: Richard de Neufville
View the complete course: https://ocw.mit.edu/courses/ids-333-risk-and-decision-analysis-fall-2021/
YouTube Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLUl4u3cNGP62jwhTqp8_1kwrkDkxZhpQC

Valuation of distributions of outcomes, involves risk-reward trade-offs between average and extreme performance. As these trade-offs are generally subjective, optimization is not meaningful.
